doc.after: One key innovation of the rotorcraft is the fly-by-wire control system employed - the NH90 is the first helicopter in the world to be equipped with full fly-by-wire flight controls.[5][25] The flight envelope of the NH90 is capable of all-weather day-and-night operations, ship-borne operations during high sea states, across a temperature range from -40Â Â°C to +50Â Â°C, and up to a maximum altitude of 20,000 feet.[26] Power is provided by a pair of turboshaft engines, dependent on customer selection, the NH90 is either fitted with Rolls-Royce Turbomeca RTM322 or General Electric T700E powerplants.[27]
